boycott.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to refuse to buy something, use something, or take part in something as a way of protesting
boycott.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: We boycott all products tested on animals.
boycott.translation[1].definitions[0].de: an act of boycotting something, or the period of time when it is boycotted
boycott.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: They are now trying to organize a boycott.

boycott.translation[2].definitions[0].de: to refuse to buy something, use something, or take part in something, as a way of protesting
boycott.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: In the past, Mandela had called for people to boycott South African goods.

boycott.translation[3].definitions[0].de: when people boycott something, or the period of time when it is boycotted
